content: In the world of sports, what is the term used to describe an athlete who plays multiple positions in a single game or season?

In sports, an athlete who plays multiple positions in a single game or season is often referred to as a "utility player." This term is used across various sports to describe individuals who can adapt and perform effectively in different roles, providing flexibility and depth to the team. For example, in soccer, a utility player might be able to play in defense, midfield, and even forward positions. In basketball, a player who can play both guard and forward positions is considered a utility player. Their ability to fill in wherever needed makes them valuable assets to their teams.
